Content: [Caption, Close, Just days into 2015, the field for the next presidential race is already coming into focus. However, some of the biggest players in the campaign will not be the candidates themselves. See the people that will shape the 2016 race for the White House.    WASHINGTON (AP)  In the year that will pass before the 2016 campaign for president formally kicks off with the votes in the Iowa Caucus, any number of candidates, donors, political operatives  and people who have nothing to do with American politics  will shape the race for the White House. Heres a look at 10 people (OK, 12 people) who will be worth watching in the next year. Associated Press writers Steve Peoples and Ken Thomas in Washington, Jill Colvin in Newark, New Jersey, Will Weissert in Austin, Texas, Adam Beam in Frankfort, Kentucky, and Thomas Beaumont and Catherine Lucey in Des Moines, Iowa, contributed to this report.]
Author: [The Associated Press]
Title: [10 people to watch in 2015 who may shift the 2016 campaign]
